summary:
Here is a final summary of the provided sub-summaries:

*   **Purpose:** The Universal Credit Act 2025 aims to modify and mandate specific annual increases for Universal Credit (UC) and certain legacy Employment and Support Allowance (ESA) payment rates, including the standard allowance and the Limited Capability for Work (LCW) and Work-Related Activity (LCWRA) elements.
*   **Obligations (UC Standard Allowance & Combined):** It mandates annual increases for the UC standard allowance for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30, based on the Consumer Price Index (CPI) and additional uplift percentages, overriding standard up-rating provisions. The combined protected LCWRA amount and standard allowance must also increase annually by the relevant CPI percentage.
*   **Obligations (Legacy ESA & LCW/LCWRA Freezes):** Specific legacy ESA components (personal allowance, disability premium, support component) must also be up-rated annually by the relevant CPI percentage for 2026-2030. Conversely, the annual up-rating of both the LCW and LCWRA elements is frozen for these same tax years.
*   **Definitions & Eligibility (Claimant Categories):** The Act introduces new LCWRA element amounts, differentiated by claimant categories. Key definitions include "pre-2026 claimants" (those continuously receiving LCWRA before April 6, 2026) and "Severe Conditions Criteria (SCC) claimants." The "relevant CPI percentage" is defined as the year-on-year increase in the Consumer Prices Index for September.
*   **Definitions & Eligibility (SCC Claimants):** An SCC claimant is defined as an individual with LCWRA whose lifelong, constantly applicable, professionally diagnosed bodily or mental condition meets specific Schedule 7 descriptors. A new, lower LCWRA amount is introduced for claimants who do not fall into the "pre-2026," "severe conditions criteria," or "terminally ill" categories.
*   **Enforcement & Assessment Rules:** Once an SCC claimant determination is made, no further assessment will be carried out unless "relevant evidence" (e.g., a material factual error or significant change) emerges. These provisions, including changes to assessment rules and information requirements, come into force on April 6, 2026, with corresponding mandates for Northern Ireland.

sections.definitions:
The Act defines the following terms:
- **consumer prices index**: the all items consumer prices index published by the Statistics Board (Section 1(6)(a), Section 4(4)(b), Schedule 2 Para 1(5)(a), Schedule 2 Para 3(4)(b)).
- **relevant power**: (i) the power in section 9(2) of the Welfare Reform Act 2012, or (ii) the power in section 150(2)(b) of the Social Security Administration Act 1992 (Section 1(6)(b)). For Northern Ireland, it means (i) the power in Article 14(2) of the Welfare Reform (Northern Ireland) Order 2015, or (ii) the power in section 132 of the Social Security Administration (Northern Ireland) Act 1992 (Schedule 2 Para 1(5)(b)).
- **standard allowance**: the allowance to be included in an award of universal credit under section 9(1) of the Welfare Reform Act 2012 (Section 1(6)(c), Section 4(3)(c)). For Northern Ireland, it means the allowance to be included in an award of universal credit under Article 14(1) of the Welfare Reform (Northern Ireland) Order 2015 (Schedule 2 Para 1(5)(c), Schedule 2 Para 3(3)(c)).
- **standard allowance for a tax year**: the standard allowance applicable for any assessment period commencing on or after the first Monday of that tax year and before the first Monday of the following tax year (Section 1(6)(d), Section 4(3)(d), Schedule 2 Para 1(5)(d), Schedule 2 Para 3(3)(d)).
- **assessment period**: has the same meaning as in Part 1 of the Welfare Reform Act 2012 (for GB) or Part 2 of the Welfare Reform (Northern Ireland) Order 2015 (for NI) (Section 1(6)(d), Section 2(3), Section 4(3)(d), Schedule 2 Para 1(5)(d), Schedule 2 Para 3(3)(d), Schedule 2 Para 2(10)).
- **tax year**: the 12 months beginning with 6 April in any year (Section 1(7)(a), Schedule 2 Para 1(6)(a)).
- **tax year 2025-26**: the tax year beginning on 6 April 2025 (Section 1(7)(b), Schedule 2 Para 1(6)(b)).
- **LCWRA element**: has the meaning given by regulation 27 of the Universal Credit Regulations 2013 (for GB) or regulation 28 of the Universal Credit Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2016 (for NI) (Section 3(2)(a), Section 4(3)(b), Schedule 2 Para 3(3)(b)).
- **LCW element**: has the meaning given by regulation 27 of the Universal Credit Regulations 2013 (so far as saved by paragraph 8 of Schedule 2 to the Employment and Support Allowance and Universal Credit (Miscellaneous Amendments and Transitional and Savings Provisions) Regulations 2017) (Section 3(2)(b)).
- **protected LCWRA amount**: the amount of the LCWRA element that applies to a pre-2026 claimant, a severe conditions criteria claimant or a claimant who is terminally ill (within the meanings of the Universal Credit Regulations 2013 for GB, or Universal Credit Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2016 for NI) (Section 4(3)(a), Schedule 2 Para 3(3)(a)).
- **relevant CPI percentage for a tax year**: the percentage by which the consumer prices index for the September before the start of the tax year is higher than it was for the September before that (or 0% if it is not higher) (Section 1(3), Section 4(4)(a), Schedule 2 Para 1(3), Schedule 2 Para 3(4)(a)).
- **ESA IR personal allowance**: an amount (i) that is prescribed under section 4(2)(a) of the Welfare Reform Act 2007 (amount of income-related allowance), and (ii) that is not an amount of a premium specified in Part 3 of Schedule 4 to the Employment and Support Allowance Regulations 2008 or an amount in respect of housing costs (for GB). For NI, prescribed under section 4(2)(a) of the Welfare Reform Act (Northern Ireland) 2007, and not an amount of a premium specified in Part 3 of Schedule 4 to the Employment and Support Allowance Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2008 or an amount in respect of housing costs (Section 5(5)(a), Schedule 2 Para 4(4)(a)).
- **ESA IR disability premium**: an amount of the severe disability premium or enhanced disability premium specified in Part 3 of Schedule 4 to the Employment and Support Allowance Regulations 2008, so far as prescribed under section 4(2)(a) of the Welfare Reform Act 2007 (for GB) (Section 5(5)(b)).
- **ESA IR support component**: the amount specified in paragraph 13 of Part 4 of Schedule 4 to the Employment and Support Allowance Regulations 2008, so far as specified under section 4(6)(c) of the Welfare Reform Act 2007 (for GB) (Section 5(5)(c)).
- **ESA IR work-related activity component**: the amount specified in paragraph 12 of Part 4 of Schedule 4 to the Employment and Support Allowance Regulations 2008, so far as specified under section 4(6)(c) of the Welfare Reform Act 2007 for the purposes of cases falling within paragraphs 2 to 7 of Schedule 2 to the Employment and Support Allowance and Universal Credit (Miscellaneous Amendments and Transitional and Savings Provisions) Regulations 2017 (for GB) (Section 5(5)(d)).
- **benefit week**: has the same meaning as in the Employment and Support Allowance Regulations 2008 (for GB) or Employment and Support Allowance Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2008 (for NI) (Section 5(5)(e), Schedule 2 Para 4(4)(b)).
- **pre-2026 claimant**: a claimant with limited capability for work and work-related activity who (a) was entitled at any time before 6 April 2026 to an award of universal credit that included the LCWRA element, and (b) has been entitled to an award of universal credit that included the LCWRA element continuously from that time (Schedule 1 Para 3(1), Schedule 2 Para 2(4)(1)).
- **severe conditions criteria claimant**: a claimant for whom it has been determined, on the basis of an assessment, that they meet the severe conditions criteria (Schedule 1 Para 2, Schedule 1 Para 5, Schedule 2 Para 2(2), Schedule 2 Para 2(6)).
- **constantly applies**: a descriptor applies to a claimant at all times or on all occasions on which the claimant undertakes or attempts to undertake the activity described by that descriptor (Schedule 1 Para 5(4), Schedule 2 Para 2(6)(4)).
- **NHS services**: health care services provided for the purposes of the health service continued under section 1(1) of the National Health Service Act 2006, section 1(1) of the National Health Service (Wales) Act 2006, section 1(1) of the National Health Service (Scotland) Act 1978; or health and social care within the meaning of the Health and Social Care (Reform) Act (Northern Ireland) 2009 provided for the purposes of the system promoted under section 2(1) of that Act (Schedule 1 Para 5(5)).
- **relevant evidence**: evidence to suggest that (a) the determination was made in ignorance of, or based on a mistake as to, some material fact, or (b) there has been a relevant change of circumstances in relation to the claimant’s physical or mental condition (Schedule 1 Para 6(6), Schedule 2 Para 2(7)(6)).
- **health and social care services (NI)**: health and social care within the meaning of the Health and Social Care (Reform) Act (Northern Ireland) 2009 provided for the purposes of the system promoted under section 2(1) of that Act; or health care services provided for the purposes of the health service continued under section 1(1) of the National Health Service Act 2006, section 1(1) of the National Health Service (Wales) Act 2006, section 1(1) of the National Health Service (Scotland) 1978 (Schedule 2 Para 2(6)(5)).
sections.obligations:
The Act outlines the following obligations:
- The Secretary of State must exercise a relevant power to secure that the standard allowance amounts for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30 are at least the calculated minimum amounts (Section 1(1)).
- Subsections (1) and (2)(c) of section 150 of the Social Security Administration Act 1992 (annual up-rating of benefits) do not apply to any amount of the standard allowance for tax years ending with 5 April 2026, 2027, 2028, and 2029 (Section 1(5)).
- Subsections (1) and (2) of section 150 of the Social Security Administration Act 1992 do not apply to the LCWRA element or the LCW element for tax years ending with 5 April 2026, 2027, 2028, and 2029 (Section 3(1)).
- Where necessary to achieve a specified result, the Secretary of State must exercise the power in section 9(2) or 12(3) of the Welfare Reform Act 2012 to increase the protected LCWRA amount or any amount of the standard allowance for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30 (Section 4(1)).
- Subsections (1) and (2) of section 150 of the Social Security Administration Act 1992 do not apply to ESA IR disability premium, ESA IR support component, or ESA IR work-related activity component for tax years ending with 5 April 2026, 2027, 2028, and 2029 (Section 5(2)).
- Where necessary to achieve a specified result, the Secretary of State must exercise the power in section 4(2)(a) or (6)(c) of the Welfare Reform Act 2007 to increase any amount of an ESA IR disability premium, the ESA IR support component, or any amount of the ESA IR personal allowance for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30 (Section 5(3)).
- Claimants are required to provide information for assessment of capability for work or work-related activity, or for being a severe conditions criteria claimant (Schedule 1 Para 7(a), Schedule 2 Para 2(8)(a)).
- Claimants are required to undergo a medical examination for assessment of capability for work or work-related activity, or for being a severe conditions criteria claimant (Schedule 1 Para 8(a), Schedule 2 Para 2(9)(a)).
- **Northern Ireland Specific:** The Department for Communities in Northern Ireland must exercise a relevant power to secure that the standard allowance amounts for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30 are at least the calculated minimum amounts (Schedule 2 Para 1(1)).
- **Northern Ireland Specific:** Where necessary to achieve a specified result, the Department for Communities in Northern Ireland must exercise the power in Article 14(2) or 17(3) of the Welfare Reform (Northern Ireland) Order 2015 to increase the protected LCWRA amount or any amount of the standard allowance for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30 (Schedule 2 Para 3(1)).
- **Northern Ireland Specific:** Where necessary to achieve a specified result, the Department for Communities in Northern Ireland must exercise the power in section 4(2)(a) or (6)(c) of the Welfare Reform Act (Northern Ireland) 2007 to increase any amount of severe disability premium or enhanced disability premium, the amount specified in paragraph 13 of Part 4 of Schedule 4, or any amount of the ESA IR personal allowance for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30 (Schedule 2 Para 4(2)).
sections.eligibility:
The Act specifies eligibility criteria as follows:
- The LCWRA element applies to a claimant with limited capability for work and work-related activity, other than a pre-2026 claimant, a severe conditions criteria claimant, or a claimant who is terminally ill (for a specific amount of £217.26) (Section 2(1)(a), Schedule 2 Para 2(5)(a)).
- The LCWRA element is awarded by reference to whether the claimant is (a) a pre-2026 claimant, (b) a severe conditions criteria claimant, (c) terminally ill, or (d) any other claimant (Schedule 1 Para 2(a), Schedule 2 Para 2(3)(a)).
- A claimant is a **pre-2026 claimant** if they (a) were entitled at any time before 6 April 2026 to an award of universal credit that included the LCWRA element, and (b) have been entitled to an award of universal credit that included the LCWRA element continuously from that time (Schedule 1 Para 3(1), Schedule 2 Para 2(4)(1)).
- For determining continuous entitlement, no account is taken of non-entitlement periods that begin because the financial condition in section 5(1)(b) or (2)(b) of the Act ceases to be met and ends within six months (Schedule 1 Para 3(2), Schedule 2 Para 2(4)(2)).
- A claimant is a **severe conditions criteria claimant** if it has been determined on the basis of an assessment that they (a) have limited capability for work and work-related activity, and (b) at least one of the descriptors set out in Schedule 7 constantly applies to them and will do so for the rest of their life (Schedule 1 Para 5(1), (2), Schedule 2 Para 2(6)(1), (2)).
- The incapability to perform activities listed in Schedule 7 must arise from a specific bodily disease or disablement (descriptors 1-8, 15(a), 15(b), 16(a), 16(b)) or a specific mental illness or disablement (descriptors 9-14, 15(c), 15(d), 16(c), 16(d)) that the claimant will have for the rest of their life and has been diagnosed by an appropriately qualified health care professional in the course of NHS services (for GB) or health and social care services (for NI) (Schedule 1 Para 5(3), Schedule 2 Para 2(6)(3)).
- No further assessment for limited capability for work is to be carried out if it has been previously determined that the claimant does not have limited capability for work or is a severe conditions criteria claimant, unless there is relevant evidence (Schedule 1 Para 6(4), Schedule 2 Para 2(7)(4)).
- No further assessment for reviewing a determination that the claimant is not a severe conditions criteria claimant is to be carried out if it has been previously determined that the claimant has limited capability for work and is not a severe conditions criteria claimant, unless there is relevant evidence (Schedule 1 Para 6(5), Schedule 2 Para 2(7)(5)).
sections.payments:
The Act details payments as follows:
- Standard allowance amounts for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30 are calculated by:
    - Step 1: Taking 2025-26 amounts (for 2026-27) or previous year's Step 2 results (for subsequent years).
    - Step 2: Increasing Step 1 amounts by the relevant CPI percentage.
    - Step 3: Increasing Step 2 amounts by the relevant uplift percentage (2.3% for 2026-27, 3.1% for 2027-28, 4.0% for 2028-29, 4.8% for 2029-30) (Section 1(2), (4), Schedule 2 Para 1(2), (4)).
- The LCWRA element amount for a claimant with limited capability for work and work-related activity (other than a pre-2026 claimant, a severe conditions criteria claimant or a claimant who is terminally ill) is £217.26 (Section 2(1)(a), Schedule 2 Para 2(5)(a)).
- Where the LCWRA element for joint claimants is a different amount, the higher amount is included (Schedule 1 Para 2(c)(ii), Schedule 2 Para 2(3)(c)(ii)).
- The sum of the protected LCWRA amount and an amount of the standard allowance for the current tax year must be at least the sum of those amounts for the previous tax year, increased by the relevant CPI percentage for the current tax year (Section 4(2), Schedule 2 Para 3(2)).
- Section 1's calculation method for standard allowance applies to ESA IR personal allowance for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30 (Section 5(1)).
- The sum of ESA IR disability premium, ESA IR support component, and ESA IR personal allowance for the current tax year must be at least the sum of those amounts for the previous tax year, increased by the relevant CPI percentage for the current tax year (Section 5(4), Schedule 2 Para 4(3)).

rule_checks.evidence: Section 1(6) - In this section (a) consumer prices index means the all items consumer prices index published by the Statistics Board; (b) a relevant power means (i) the power in section 9(2) of the Welfare Reform Act 2012, or (ii) the power in section 150(2)(b) of the Social Security Administration Act 1992; (c) the standard allowance means the allowance to be included in an award of universal credit under section 9(1) of the Welfare Reform Act 2012; (d) the standard allowance for a tax year means the standard allowance applicable for any assessment period commencing on or after the first Monday of that tax year and before the first Monday of the following tax year, and for this purpose assessment period has the same meaning as in Part 1 of that Act. Section 1(7) - In this section and sections 3 to 5 (a) tax year means the 12 months beginning with 6 April in any year; (b) tax year 2025-26 means the tax year beginning on 6 April 2025 (and any corresponding expression in which two years are similarly mentioned is to be read in the same way).

Schedule 1, Regulation 27A(1) - For the purposes of regulation 27, a claimant with limited capability for work and work-related activity is a pre-2026 claimant if the claimant (a) was entitled at any time before 6 April 2026 to an award of universal credit that included the LCWRA element, and (b) has been entitled to an award of universal credit that included the LCWRA element continuously from that time. Schedule 1, Regulation 40A(2) - A claimant is a severe conditions criteria claimant on the basis of an assessment under this Part if (a) the claimant has limited capability for work and work-related activity on the basis of an assessment under this Part (see regulation 40(2)), and (b) at least one of the descriptors set out in Schedule 7 constantly applies to the claimant and will do so for the rest of the claimant s life.

rule_checks.rule: Act must specify what the authority (government) must do
rule_checks.evidence: Section 1(1) - The Secretary of State must exercise a relevant power in order to secure that the amounts of the standard allowance for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30 are at least the amounts calculated for each tax year in accordance with subsection (2). Section 4(1) - Where it is necessary in order to achieve the result in subsection (2) for any of the tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30, the Secretary of State must exercise the power in section 9(2) or 12(3) of the Welfare Reform Act 2012 to increase (a) the protected LCWRA amount for that tax year, or (b) any amount of the standard allowance for that tax year.

rule_checks.rule: Act must list penalties or enforcement methods
rule_checks.evidence: The document does not contain any provisions detailing penalties, fines, or specific enforcement methods for non-compliance with its stipulations. Its primary focus is on altering benefit rates and related eligibility criteria.

rule_checks.rule: Act must explain how to calculate payments
rule_checks.evidence: Section 1(2) - The minimum amounts of the standard allowance for a tax year are calculated as follows Step 1 Where the tax year is 2026-27, take the amounts of the standard allowance for tax year 2025-26. Where the tax year is 2027-28, 2028-29 or 2029-30, take the amounts resulting from Step 2 for the previous tax year. Step 2 Increase the amounts identified in Step 1 by the relevant CPI percentage for the tax year. Step 3 Increase the amounts resulting from Step 2 by the relevant uplift percentage for the tax year. Section 1(3) - The relevant CPI percentage for a tax year is the percentage by which the consumer prices index for the September before the start of the tax year is higher than it was for the September before that (or 0% if it is not higher). Section 1(4) - The table below sets out the relevant uplift percentage for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30 [table with percentages].

rule_checks.rule: Act must require records or reporting
rule_checks.evidence: The document does not introduce new, explicit requirements for individuals, businesses, or government agencies to keep records or submit reports. While it amends existing regulations that involve information requirements (e.g., Schedule 1, Regulation 43 refers to a claimant providing information), these are modifications to existing processes rather than new record-keeping or reporting obligations imposed by this Act itself.
